original: Eriksson, Nils Einar, arkitekt, Göteborg, f. 10/7/99 i Solna av Nils E. o. Kristina Sundquist. G. 26 m. Greta Johansson. Barn: Gunn Kerstin f. 28, Karin Margareta 31, Lars Einar 33. — Avg:ex. fr. byggn :yrkessk. i Sthlm 18, tekn. högsk. arkit :facksk. 22, kons’thögsk. 25. Stud:res. t. Ital., Grekl, Frankr. o. Engl. 25-27. Anst. à arkit. Carl Akerblads kont. i Sthlm 18-19, å Cyrillus Johanssons kont. där 19-21, å Hakon Ahlbergs kont. där 24, h. prof. E. G. Asplund där 28-30, prakt, arkit. i Sthlm 30-32 o. i Gbg sed. 32. Utf. ritn. t. Gbgs konserthus 32-35, Thulehuset i Gbg 33-37, Sv. mässan i Gbg 39, kont:huset Centrum i Gbg 35-38, inredn. t. m/s Sthlm m. m. Första pris v. tävl. om byggn. f. Nationernas Förbund i Genève 27. RVO, Prins EugenM, LFrKA, LIVA.
translated: Eriksson, Nils Einar, architect, Gothenburg, born July 10th, 1899 in Solna to Nils E. and Kristina Sundquist. Married to Greta Johansson in 1926. Children: Gunn Kerstin born in 1928, Karin Margareta born in 1931, Lars Einar born in 1933. Graduated from the building trade school in Stockholm in 1918, technical university architectural school in 1922, and the fine arts college in 1925. Studied abroad in Italy, Greece, France, and England from 1925-1927. Employed at architect Carl Akerblad's office in Stockholm from 1918-1919, at Cyrillus Johansson's office from 1919-1921, at Hakon Ahlberg's office in 1924, with professor E. G. Asplund from 1928-1930, and as a practical architect in Stockholm from 1930-1932 before moving to Gothenburg. Created designs for Gothenburg's concert hall from 1932-1935, Thule House in Gothenburg from 1933-1937, the Swedish exhibition in Gothenburg in 1939, Centrum office building in Gothenburg from 1935-1938, and the interior design of the S/S Stockholm, among other projects. Awarded first prize in the competition for the building for the League of Nations in Geneva in 1927. Received the Order of Vasa, Prince Eugen Medal, the Litteris et Artibus, and the L’Ordre des Arts et des Lettres.

works.name: Interior design of the S/S Stockholm
Building for the League of Nations in Geneva

awards.name: L’Ordre des Arts et des Lettres
